result.execSummary:
The defendant Houston Roger Wilson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus costs, DNA surcharge.  Bail to apply.  Any amounts due and owing within 60 days, due by 12/29/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant's operating privleges for operation of Class D vehciles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 26 months thereafter.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber for work.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised  his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Houston Roger Wilson Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release privileges signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and HOC.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge CimplBr 19 for review. os
Order for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
FROM HAYES & ROTHSTEIN.  REQUESTING AN IGINTION INTERLOCK EXEMPTION FOR TWO VEHICLES: A 1994 MITSUBISHI MIRAGE AND A 1995 CHEVROLET BLAZER.

Defendant Houston Roger Wilson in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  11 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Huber for work.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered revocation of defendant's driver license for 26 months,
Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  26 months  thereafter.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay fine in the amount of $600.00 plus costs.  
Pay DNA surcharges;
Cash bail to apply.  Any amounts due and owing within 60 days due by 12/29/2015
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Houston Roger Wilson in court with attorney Patrick J Anderson.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

On defense motion, the Court accepts waiver of time limits as to the scheduling of the preliminary hearing.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  SCRAM ORDERED.  

NO driving without valid drivers license.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Houston Roger Wilson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Houston Roger Wilson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
